passages.text:
You approach a small overlook.  A fresh breeze pours through the open windows.

Julia::Please, Miss, let's not linger here.  I hate this room.

[[p:Can we hang out here for just a bit?  This is the first time I've gotten fresh air since I made it here.]]
[[p:You'd rather go back to the moldy, claustrophobic hallways?  Because to be honest that sounds preferable to me as well.]]

links.name: p:Can we hang out here for just a bit?  This is the first time I've gotten fresh air since I made it here.
links.link: p:Can we hang out here for just a bit?  This is the first time I've gotten fresh air since I made it here.

links.name: p:You'd rather go back to the moldy, claustrophobic hallways?  Because to be honest that sounds preferable to me as well.
links.link: p:You'd rather go back to the moldy, claustrophobic hallways?  Because to be honest that sounds preferable to me as well.

passages.name: Untitled Passage

passages.text:
Julia::Miss, there is nothing fresh about the air here.

Now that she's mentioned it, you do detect a hint of rot in your nostrils.

[[p:Yeah, what's up with that smell?]]

links.name: p:Yeah, what's up with that smell?
links.link: p:Yeah, what's up with that smell?

passages.name: p:Can we hang out here for just a bit?  This is the first time I've gotten fresh air since I made it here.

passages.text:
Julia::Yes, I really would.  I hate this overlook.

Julia::Hate the view.  Hate the crib.  More than anything, I hate the smell.

[[p:Yeah, what's up with that smell?]]

links.name: p:Yeah, what's up with that smell?
links.link: p:Yeah, what's up with that smell?

passages.name: p:You'd rather go back to the moldy, claustrophobic hallways?  Because to be honest that sounds preferable to me as well.

passages.text:
Jasper::Don't be coy, you recognize this smell.  It's the fruity smell of rot.

Julia glances down in surrender.

Julia::You're going to make me say it, aren't you?

Julia::Sick babies, ones we've exhausted treatment for.  This is where we leave them.  

Julia::Right here, in this crib.

Julia::We tell the parents that there's nothing else we can do, but they still have a chance if they get some sunlight and fresh air.

Julia::One of those claims is true.

Julia::We know it's not gonna work.  I think the mom and dad usually know, too.  But we keep bringing babies here all the same.

Julia::*I* keep bringing babies here.  They always make me do it.

[[p:That's...genuinely horrific.]]
[[p:I guess that explains the smell.]]

links.name: p:I guess that explains the smell.
links.link: p:I guess that explains the smell.

passages.name: p:Yeah, what's up with that smell?

passages.text:
Julia returns to you with a newfound intensity.

Julia::Someone has to do this dirty work, Miss.  If I don't, no one will.

[[Did any of the babies you left here pull through?]]
[[How many infants get sick and die here?]]
[[p:Why did it always fall on you?]]

links.name: Did any of the babies you left here pull through?
links.link: Did any of the babies you left here pull through?

links.name: How many infants get sick and die here?
links.link: How many infants get sick and die here?

links.name: p:Why did it always fall on you?
links.link: p:Why did it always fall on you?

passages.name: p:That's...genuinely horrific.

passages.text:
Julia::We don't even bother cleaning the crib after collection.  Of course it reeks.

[[C->p:That's...genuinely horrific.]]
passages.name: p:I guess that explains the smell.

passages.text:
Julia::Only a handful.  Babies that have a real chance don't end up here.

[[C->p:That's...genuinely horrific.]]
passages.name: Did any of the babies you left here pull through?

passages.text:
Julia::It didn't always.  They used to just make the newest nurse take on this responsibility.  

Julia::But I...

Julia::I don't want to go into it, but I'm very indebted to some of the higher up staff here.

Julia::So a lot of the tougher work is falling on me for a while.

[[That isn't fair.  You shouldn't have to do all of this alone.]]

links.name: That isn't fair.  You shouldn't have to do all of this alone.
links.link: That isn't fair.  You shouldn't have to do all of this alone.

passages.name: p:Why did it always fall on you?

passages.text: Julia::Life isn't fair, miss.  I've made my peace with that, and I suggest you do the same.
passages.name: That isn't fair.  You shouldn't have to do all of this alone.

passages.text:
Julia::Before our budget was reduced?  Too many.

Julia::After the slash?  Way, way too many.  Usually of respiratory distress.

[[C->p:That's...genuinely horrific.]]
passages.name: How many infants get sick and die here?
